00319       // ===============================================================
00320       //                                                   StringMasks =
00321       // ===============================================================
00322       
00332          #define STRING_LANGUAGE_MASK 0xFE000000
00333 
00338          #define INVALID_STRING_INFO  (STRING_LANGUAGE_MASK+STRING_TYPE_MASK)
00339 
00345          #define STRING_LANGUAGE_SHIFT 25
00346 
00353          #define GET_STRING_LANGUAGE(a) LangTypes::language_t( \
00354                (STRING_LANGUAGE_MASK & a) >> STRING_LANGUAGE_SHIFT)
00355 
00360          #define STRING_TYPE_MASK 0x01C00000
00361 
00367          #define STRING_TYPE_SHIFT 22
00368 
00375          #define GET_STRING_TYPE(a) ItemTypes::name_t( \
00376             (STRING_TYPE_MASK & a) >> STRING_TYPE_SHIFT)
00377 
00382          #define STRING_INDEX_MASK 0x003FFFFF
00383       
00389          #define STRING_INDEX_SHIFT 0
00390 
00397          #define GET_STRING_INDEX(a) ( (STRING_INDEX_MASK & a) \
00398                      >> STRING_INDEX_SHIFT)
00399 
00406          #define GET_STRING_INFO(a)  ( ((!STRING_INDEX_MASK) & a) \
00407             >> STRING_INDEX_SHIFT)
00408       
00413          #define CREATE_NEW_NAME(lang, typ, idx) ( (lang << \
00414             STRING_LANGUAGE_SHIFT) | (typ << STRING_TYPE_SHIFT) | (idx) )

01061       #define STATE_MASK 0xff000000
01062       
01068       #define TRANSPORTATION_STATE_MASK 0xf0000000
01069 
01074       #define ADD_COST_STATE_MASK 0xf1000000
01075       
01080       #define GET_TRANSPORTATION_STATE(a) ItemTypes::transportation_t( \
01081             ( ((a) & STATE_MASK) == TRANSPORTATION_STATE_MASK )\
01082             ? ((a)&(~(STATE_MASK))) : 0 )  
01083 
01087       #define GET_ADDITIONAL_COST_STATE(a) ( \
01088               (((a) & STATE_MASK) == ADD_COST_STATE_MASK ) ? \
01089               ( (a) & (~(STATE_MASK))) : 0 )

01149

01751    
01756       struct lmdescription_t {
01757             // The id of the item representing the landmark,
01758             // e.g.  a built-up area, a railway or an individual building
01759             uint32 itemID;
01760             // is a measure of how important the landmark is. The scale is
01761             // from 0-4, where 0 is most important and 4 is least important
01762             uint32 importance;
01763             // describes on which side of a road/crossing the landmark is 
01764             // located, to the right or left. A special case is when the 
01765             // road/crossing is located in the landmark, when driving 
01766             // straight ahead, the description will be to pass through.
01767             SearchTypes::side_t side;
01768             // describes how the crossing/road is located in relation to 
01769             // the landmark,
01770             // e.g. that you should turn after, before, in or at the landmark.
01771             // Another alternative is to pass the landmark.
01772             landmarklocation_t location;
01773             // gives what kind of landmark is it.
01774             landmark_t type;
01775       };
01776      
01784       static int getLandmarkLocationFromString(const char* str);
01785       
01789       static StringCode getLandmarkLocationSC( landmarklocation_t t);
01790 
01798       static int getLandmarkSideFromString(const char*);
01799       
01803       static StringCode getLandmarkSideSC(SearchTypes::side_t t);

02012 inline bool
02013 ItemTypes::isPassengerCar(ItemTypes::vehicle_t t )
02014 {
02015    switch ( t ) {
02016       case ( ItemTypes::passengerCar ) :
02017       case ( ItemTypes::passCarClosedSeason ) :
02018          return true;
02019          break;
02020       default:
02021          return false;
02022          break;
02023    }
02024 }
02025 
02026 inline bool
02027 ItemTypes::isPassengerCar(uint32 t)
02028 {
02029    return isPassengerCar( ItemTypes::vehicle_t(t) );
02030 }

02033 ItemTypes::itemTypeToSearchType(ItemTypes::itemType theType)
02034 {
